column7: is a small park located in the Carlson Park neighborhood of Culver City
column8: CA. It is linear in shape and is intended for passive recreational use
column9: featuring open grassy spaces as well as picnic and barbecue facilities. It is named for Dr. Paul Carlson
column10: a former resident of Culver City whose martyrdom in the Democratic Republic of the Congo in 1964 attracted national attention.
